summary: Demeter is an important goddess in ancient Greek mythology. She is in charge of agriculture, crops, and the earth's fertility. Demeter is known for her role in the story of her daughter, Persephone, who was abducted by Hades, the god of the Underworld. This story explains the changing seasons. Demeter is also linked to the Eleusinian Mysteries, an ancient religious festival. She is often shown as a powerful figure in art, like the marble relief from the 4th century BC.
title: Demeter
